rComments: Might be the easiest class I've ever taken at the university of Ottawa. He asked the students what we think the project should be on, and took our constructive criticism to heart. Midterm is multiple choice and super easy, took about 15 minutes. The essay (which is on literally any topic you choose) was easy as well, if not a little long (12pages)

He's fine. He doesn't use slides and hardly ever uses virtual campus. If you have a class with him you'll literally be listening to him just talk the whole time, no visual aid. He takes random attendance both times I've had him I got 0/5 because if you miss more than 3 attendances its an automatic 0. His marking is pretty fair (most of the time).

He takes random attendance, and will snake you, especially for those who bus to school. On snowstorm days when your busses are late or cancelled hell take attendance and marks you absent and wont fix it because it wasn't a valid reason even though the busses were cancelled. Doesn't use slides. sometimes wont show up without notice

Great prof and very fair. He CLEARLY informs you about the his examination methods (no ppt provided, format) during the first class. He is a highly structured professor. It is an easy A if you ATTEND every class and take detailed notes. All the people complaining have clearly been skipping class or have yet to learn the art of taking notes.

The prof overall is OK. But to pass the class you must attend EVERY SINGLE CLASS. He does not use Brightspace and speaks extremely fast. Be ready to write down everything he says since its going to be on the midterms. The "final" was easy and the only part where you need a textbook since the question is chosen by the student from the textbook.

The reviews are glowing for Tonio, but honestly, I thought his class was mediocre at best. Lots of wasted time went to things like attendance for 250 people, and also signing your essay in instead of just placing it in a pile. Aside from that, his lectures are the usual. Nothing incredibly mind-blowing or something you don't already know. Meh.
He explains the topics really clearly. Make sure you attend each lecture and take good notes.

He is certainly a great lecturer for a very dull subject. He has absolutely no expectations from his class and gives us rather easy exams only based on his lectures, not the textbook. Which is great but at the same time, he shows that he doesn't care about the success of his students and can act rather snobby 90% of the time.

This professor is a good lecturer, however, he refuses to use any visuals for his lectures and barely writes anything on the board. You need to make sure you type quality notes on the fly very quickly as he speaks and brings up important topics. His multiple choices are relatively easy, final exam essay questions were difficult.

Tonio is an amazing and passionate lecturer with a great sense of humour. He explains everything in a very clear and concise manner, and engages the class in fun and intellectual discussions. He is always very well prepared for his classes. The exams are a combination of multiple choice questions and short essays. I highly recommend this Professor.

Tonio is a great lecturer - he's very engaging and delivers the course content in a very efficient manner. You can tell he makes an effort to tailor the needs of telfer students (it's barely a real sociology class... anyone with any academic background and mild intelligence should be able to get a good grade in this class)

Attend every single lecture, take good notes, read the booklet and you will receive an amazing great! Tonio is a great lecturer! His midterm was super easy; however, his MC on the final was a bit challenging. I enjoyed the course and highly recommend it.

His lectures are fun, there's always a dialogue,  and he's a very good public speaker. The midterm and final are 80% based on the lectures, 15% on the booklet, 5% on the book (5% left for approximation). His multiple choice is very tough, you need to take very good notes and really focus in the lecture. For the paper, be as analytical as possible.

It's almost as though he has this amazing speech memorized every single class - he delivers with such clarity and confidence, I'm always amazed. You can tell he's passionate about the topic, and it's very refreshing from my typical business school work. Some of my (ahem accountants) friends didn't know how to take notes ;)

He assigns alot of lectures but even if you don't read them, you will still easily pass. Didn't buy the book or the course pack and passed with an A. Make sure you go to class though because he doesn't post notes online and the 99% of the exams cover what he says in class.
mean to international student.
Very mean to international student, racism.

he makes the course content very interesting. He does not relate to the business students who have never written an academic essay in a university setting. The t.a marks way to strict, and you can tell they like to shove it to capitalist business students who believe robots are not only profitable but can do a better job markingteaching.

Tonio may very love teaching the course and be very good at it, however, he does not keep in mind that the course is mandatory for Telfer students. Thus, most (if not all) of the class is composed of Telfer students whom lack the background of intro to soc which is an ordinary prereq to the class. +You can tell he doesn't like business students.

Excellent Prof. The lectures are very interesting, and its easier to pay attention in his classes compared to other classes at Ottawa U. Good discussion about the various technological issues. The midterm was easy. For the midterm, the questions are all based on what he says in class and from the articles in the reader.

very annoying and difficult to follow when he speaks. You must be extremely good at typing or listening his entire lecture in verbatim to do well. He goes off on a lot of tangents and his speech tempo and pattern is very awkward to keep up with.

presented the course outline twice, 1st and 2nd class, wasted everyones time. this class is stupid and pointless, but he makes it seem like the world revolves around his class. he's a great lecturer, but all over the place. if you can take another section take it, as he makes his section hard for no particular reason.

Tonio - great lecturer and very well spoken, however doesn't tie the points of the course together that well - speaks mostly about the themes in isolation and then asks you to put it all together on the essay question in the exam.. start the essay early and go to class and you will do just fine, thanks Tonio!
Definatley hated this prof. the best part was teh guest lecturer
Completely agreed with the person below.

Kind of out of touch considering he is teaching Society, World and Technology. Also, made some really off hand, uneducated and sometimes inappropriate comments. The paper was easy and the exams straightforward. You don't really need the textbook (I didn't buy it and did absolutely fine) just go to class.
Great professor! He is an excellent lecturer and more importantly, there to help you during office hours. I found his advice very helpful and relevant for my term paper.
very passionate about his work. i really enjoyed this class. if a discussion starts, its always interesting.

Great lecturer, clear about what he says. However: not very available outside of class hours + his marking scheme for the course is quite strange. E.g., midterm is 30 questions, and it's worth 30%. So every question is worth 1% of final grade. Same scenario for final exam. Term paper worth 30% and graded out of - you guessed it, 30 marks. Sheesh...

Best prof ever!!  I loved this class.  His lectures as so clear and succint, almost asthough you are listening to a story. Very well prepared.  Multiple choice midterm, one paper on anything you want and a multiple choice/short answer final.  I recomend this class

Tonion is probably one of the best lecturer's at u of o.  I have had him twice, and I'd take another class with him in a second.  Very clear on his expectations, very engaging and approachable.  Excellent Prof
Bad overall, superiority complex. and definantly NOT a fair marker
not good guy.

Tonio is SO nice and i LOVED this class. A lot of videos that are very relevant and interesting to the course. Rely on lectures NOT text. I am not a SOC student, yet still enjoyed the course LOVED THE CLASS!!!!!!I Recommend to anyone
nice teacher.. is straightforward.. lectures relevant material and is clear and a fair marker

Tonio is a nice guy but his teachin style requires alot of effort..u have to be an active listener and relies heavily on his lecture notes NOT textbook for midterms...his tests are tricky so be careful...class was interesting but challenging

Great Prof! Still new but I think he was great. He has a tendency of wanting to help students which is very rare. I think anyone would love this prof if they are interested in wanting to learn. He actively tried to increase student participation and it was one of the best classes I've had.
Good prof. Obviously just starting out teaching, but  interactive with the class and wants student input. Definitely has the potential to be a really good prof!

1st year teaching not a bad job. Lectures explained everything very clearly with easy to remember examples.  Attendance is imparitive or you will not do well! Problems with weight of questions on midterm. If you missed one class that could be where he explained a concept worth 1/5 of test.
Extremely Irresponsible Prof. Reads off his own set of notes during lectures. Not helpful, and terrible at giving you feedbacks. Strongly not recommended!

tonio unfortunately falls under the "nice guy, bad teacher" category. he knows his stuff, but is horrible at conveying any sort coherance or interest into his student. also, save yourself 100 bucks and dont buy the books. i never even read them and got an A-.
